PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Combining Cognitive and Utilitarian Coordination in a Layered Agent Architecture - (CUCLA)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project aims at augmenting an agent language based on mentalistic metaphors with a decision-theoretic approach to agent coordination, thus creating a powerful, innovative multi-agent framework. A two-level agent architecture will be developed that combines concurrently operating subsystems; at the higher level is a subsystem that reasons about symbolic information -- an extended version of a BDI (Beliefs-Desires-Intentions) architecture, while a lower level is a subsystem that reasons about quantitative information -- an extended version of the GPGP (Generic Partial Global Planning) architecture. Using this resulting programming language we also aim at developing two application scenarios (in Intelligent Homes and in Distance Education), with which to assess the resulting framework. Besides the use in the evaluation of the project results, these application areas also have, respectively, a huge potential in the production of industrial products and in social terms (regarding access to education). The state of the art in Multi-Agent Systems has not as yet seen the development of working systems integrating cognitive and decision-theoretic approaches to agents, as proposed in this project. The development of this two-level agent architecture, and a programming language based on it, will result in making it significantly easier to develop multi-agent systems that can function effectively in open environments (such as the internet) where the set of goals to achieve, the set of resources available, and the set of other agents are dynamically changing. The potential for such computational tool is enormous: there is presently a worldwide interest in the development of multi-agent systems, both in academia and in industry. The cooperation between the Interest Group on Artificial Intelligence at II-UFRGS and the Multi-Agent Systems Laboratory at UMASS has been going on since 1997, when Prof. Ana Bazzan was a Postdoctoral research fellow in that laboratory, working wit

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Affective Conversational Agents for learnIng
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Recent studies from psychology and neurology sciences have addressing the importance of emotions and other affective states for several intelligent cognitive processes, such as memory, decision taking and, inclusive, learning. These results have drawn the attention of Computers in Education researchers about the importance of taking into account students emotions in intelligent learning environments (ILE). In order to express emotions, the ILEs are generally incorporated with Embodied Conversational Agents (ECA). ECAs are computer-generated characters that are able to demonstrate many of the same properties as humans in face-to-face interaction, including the ability to produce and respond to verbal and nonverbal communication. As they are able to have a more anthropomorphic interaction with user, these agents have shown several benefits when included in ILEs, such as to engage students, focus their attention in important aspects of learning, demonstrate tasks, and so on. To be affective-aware, ECAs should have mechanisms in order to infer and express believable emotions. Although some results have already been acquired, real environments of interaction, as learning systems, require combining different methods and techniques with the purpose of obtaining more powerful inference mechanisms and generating more realistic verbal (text and speech) and non-verbal expression of emotions. This project aims at combining the Brazilian, Argentine and French investigation teams expertise in Artificial Intelligence applied to education and Affective Computing in order to create more affective-aware ECA and study its potential in real learning applications. Este projeto faz parte de um projeto maior entitulado: Inteligencia Artificial aplicada a educaÃ§Ã£o.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CATEDRA UNESCO - Desenvolvimento e Difusão de Novas Tecnologias para a Educação
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto tem como objetivo ampliar o Centro Interdisciplinar de Novas Tecnologias na Educação (CINTED), um centro de excelência na difusão de tecnologias educacionais e pesquisa, desenvolvendo soluções de tecnologia integrada que capacita aplicações eficientes e de custos efetivos em escolas e universidades. Dentro da responsabilidade deste empreendimento, o Cinted colaborará no melhoramento da qualidade de ensino e aprendizagem, expandindo o acesso à educação para um maior número de estudantes brasileiros, latino-americanos e africanos. Nesse contexto, o projeto está alinhado com os objetivos estratégicos correntes da UNESCO que enfatiza o aumento do acesso universal de informação e conhecimento, suporte à criação de conhecimento, aquisição e compartilhamento, e a promoção de educação digital para todos. O projeto será estruturado em quatro principais linhas de pesquisa, cada qual contendo temas de pesquisa que, juntos, irão reforçar os principais objetivos do projeto para promover melhores padrões de educação e a expansão de fronteiras na educação. Com a conexão de pesquisadores de diferentes instituições, este projeto pretende endossar iniciativas focadas em práticas de aprendizagem através do uso de informações diferentes e a tecnologia de comunicação para o melhoramento da educação
